words.definition: The clarity with which words are spoken.

example.en: Articulation is vital for making a strong impression.
example.ar: وضوح النطق مهم لترك انطباع قوي.

words.definition: The rise and fall of the voice when speaking.

example.en: Proper intonation can change the meaning of a sentence.
example.ar: يمكن للتنغيم المناسب تغيير معنى الجملة.

words.definition: The ability to speak smoothly and easily.

example.en: With practice, her fluency improved greatly.

words.definition: The quality of being accurate and exact.

example.en: He spoke with precision to avoid misunderstanding.

words.definition: The act of pronouncing words clearly.

example.en: Good enunciation makes it easier for others to understand.
example.ar: يسهل اللفظ الجيد على الآخرين فهم الكلام.

words.definition: The speed at which someone speaks.

example.en: Try to maintain a moderate pace during your presentation.
example.ar: حاول الحفاظ على سرعة معتدلة أثناء تقديمك.

words.definition: The quality of voice expressing mood or emotion.
words.arabic_definition: نوعية الصوت التي تعبر عن المزاج أو العاطفة.

example.en: Her tone was confident and assertive.

words.definition: The emphasis placed on certain words or syllables.
words.arabic_definition: التشديد على كلمات أو مقاطع معينة.

example.en: Stress the key words to make your point.
example.ar: شدد على الكلمات الرئيسية لإيضاح فكرتك.

words.definition: The state of capturing and holding the listener's attention.
words.arabic_definition: حالة جذب انتباه المستمع والحفاظ عليه.

example.en: Good speakers maintain listener engagement throughout their talk.
example.ar: المتحدث الجيد يحافظ على تفاعل المستمع طوال الحديث.

words.definition: A calm and confident manner of presenting oneself.

example.en: He spoke with poise despite the challenging questions.
example.ar: تحدث باتزان على الرغم من الأسئلة الصعبة.
